frame.name: Execute_plan
frame.definition: An Agent acts according to a Plan, carrying it out (or taking steps to carry it out). In some cases, the Agent is a focal participant in the Plan, although a separate Focal_participant may also be mentioned. The Plan may be specified for the Duration for which it is in effect. Health authorities say they have put measures into effect in all ports of entry and in centers of provinces. Channing House has recently implemented a new dining program for residents on pureed diets. Note: the phrase (put) in effect is in the Being_in_effect frame.

FE.name: Plan
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Plan</fen> is a goal or purpose that the <fen>Agent</fen> carries out.</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time for which the <fen>Plan</fen> is or is not in effect.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> at which the Agent puts the <fen>Plan</fen> into effect.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> at which the <fen>Plan</fen> is or is not operational.
[CHANGE: or, place where agent puts into effect? 2 fes?]</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The state-of-affairs under which the Agent puts the <fen>Plan</fen> into effect.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>A cause, reason, or other explanation for the implementation of the <fen>Plan</fen></def-root>

FE.name: Focal_participant
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual or group who is obligated to follow the <fen>Plan</fen>.
[CHANGE: may only be relevant for "implemented the policy for residents of florida only"]</def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen>, often an institution or governmental organization, puts a <fen>Plan</fen> into effect. The Agent is generally a primary participant in the <fen>Plan</fen>, but a separate <fen>Focal_participant</fen> may be specified.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> describes some state of the <fen>Agent</fen>, or provides additional characterization of the event of executing the plan.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> is an intermediate action done by the <fen>Agent</fen> in order to execute the <fen>Plan</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Agent</fen> executes the <fen>Plan</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes how fully the <fen>Plan</fen> was executed.</def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the medium through which a plan was executed. It may occur in the same syntactic position as the Agent. <ex>The policy will be <t>implemented</t> <fex name="Medium">by a new computer system</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Outcome
FE.definition: <def-root>The Outcome is the failure or success of executing the plan. <ex>We <t>implemented</t> the new approach <fex name="Outcome">with astounding results</fex></ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: implementation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of implementing a plan.

lexUnit.name: effect [into effect].n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the state of being or becoming operative.
